Name: Debug Entity
Bio Text: This text should not appear as the Debug Entity is not supposed to appear in any battles or appear in the Bestiary. This could happen if the game fails to parse a certain EntityID as DebugEntity is the default in the enum (0). Although, you can also see this text by hacking or datamining the game. If you're a hacker or dataminer, then you should probably stop.
Keru Text: This doesn't look right, we should report this as a bug.
Wilex Text: Oh, look. The game is broken. Sounds like someone didn't test the game enough for bugs.
Luna Text: I don't know what that is... Maybe something's wrong with the game?

Name: Leafling
Bio Text: A small, common mammal native to the Verdant Forests, although they are also found in the Solar Grove.<line><line>Despite being small, they have a ravenous appetite. Travellers should steer clear of them so the Leaflings don't mistake them for a meal.
Keru Text: Leaflings are pretty weak, so you shouldn't have much trouble with them. Try not to let them chew on you if you can.
Wilex Text: Leaflings are really annoying. All they do is chew on everything they see. Good thing they're easy to get rid of.
Luna Text: These cute little rascals love nibbling on everything they see.  Maybe we can keep one? I don't think Wilex would like that though.

Name: Flowerling
Bio Text: These relatives of Leaflings are known for their ability to fly. The propeller flowers on their heads are quite delicate, so attacking them will render the Flowerling unable to fly for the rest of battle.<line><line>Like regular Leaflings, they are constantly searching for an easy meal, so travellers should be careful around them.
Keru Text: Flowerlings can fly high enough that you need to jump on them. When you hit them, they'll fall down and won't be able to fly back up for the rest of battle.
Wilex Text: It's pretty much just a flying Leafling. Once I stomp on it, the flower will break and it won't fly anymore.
Luna Text: I can't get high enough to reach it... Maybe Wilex can jump up to it?

Name: Shrublet
Bio Text: This variant of the Leafling is covered in rough thorns and has a stronger bite, although it has slightly lower health than regular Leaflings. A layer of thorns on their body makes it dangerous to come into contact with them.<line><line>It is advisable to try to attack them with weapons instead of making contact with them directly, despite how effective direct attacks may be.
Keru Text: Shrublets are covered in thorns, so you shouldn't stomp on them. Stomping will still hurt them, but you'll get hurt too. Make sure you hit them from a distance with your weapon.<next>You should focus on them first, since their bites are somewhat strong.
Wilex Text: It's covered in thorns and has a pretty strong bite, so I better get rid of them first. Stomping on them is gonna hurt, but I might not have a choice. It'll hurt less than being chomped on, I guess.
Luna Text: Those thorns look pretty painful... I should try hitting them from a distance. Good thing I have a hammer! Their bites hurt a lot, so we should focus on getting rid of them first.

Name: Rootling
Bio Text: The guardian of the Soul Crown in the Solar Grove, who is the young child of the previous guardian. While it is much weaker than the previous guardian, it is still quite large and powerful. Similar to Leaflings, the Rootling has a large appetite, made even larger by its massive size.<line><line>The Rootling will often dig underground to evade attackers, as well as to prepare for a stronger attack when it emerges.
Keru Text: This is the guardian of the Solar Grove. It doesn't look like you have a way around fighting it... When it hides underground, it's preparing to do a stronger attack, so that is your best time to heal or prepare yourself.
Wilex Text: Looks like this is what's guarding the shrine in this place. Doesn't seem like it's that strong though. I can't hit it when it goes underground, so that's a good time to Focus.
Luna Text: Sorry we have to do this, but we really have to get through! When it goes underground, it looks like it's preparing for something big, so I should make sure we're ready for that.

Name: Sunflower
Bio Text: Sunflowers are stronger versions of Flowerlings that have flaming flowers. Their flowers are very good at absorbing sunlight, and that energy is used to fuel the flame. The flame can burn anyone trying to attack them directly.<line><line>Sunflowers rarely need to hunt for food as most of their energy comes from absorbing the sun's rays, yet they are still quite aggressive regardless. Unlike regular Flowerlings, they can quickly recover from being grounded.
Keru Text: This is a flaming version of normal Flowerlings. You'll get burned if you try to jump on them, so you should find another way to deal with them.<next>They're better at flying than normal Flowerlings, so hitting them down will only ground them until their next turn.
Wilex Text: Flying and burning... That's a dangerous combination. If I stomp on them, they will come down, but I'll get burned if I do that.<next>Maybe I should try getting them down a different way...
Luna Text: I already have a hard time with flying things, but now this guy is burning too, so Wilex can't stomp on them without getting hurt. Maybe there's something I can do to get them down...

Name: Sunnybud
Bio Text: A stronger variation of Honeybuds that lives in the deeper parts of the Solar Grove. They are more adept at absorbing sunlight than Honeybuds, which gives them stronger attacks and better healing.<line><line>Their improved healing allows them to stay airborne after healing, and they can also get off the ground and heal on the same turn.
Keru Text: This is a Sunnybud, a stronger version of the Honeybud. They have stronger attacks and stronger healing. Unlike Honeybuds, hitting them down to the ground won't stop them from healing on their turn.
Wilex Text: Looks like they can heal every turn, unlike Honeybuds. I can't even stop them from healing since they can get up and heal on the same turn.<next>I better get rid of them first so they stop that.
Luna Text: They really like sharing their honey with everyone. Why don't they share it with us? They can still heal even if they get hit down, so we should focus on them first.

Name: Goldbush
Bio Text: More aggressive than Brambleling? (lower HP but applies Illuminate to self (Hard mode: this boost move also applies Attack Boost)) (Also gets free regen so the lower hp is compensated by that) (Can roar to boost all allies with attack up 2 for 3 turns, applies Illuminate to self and attack boost in hard mode) (Has a 2 hit bite)
Keru Text: Goldbushes have natural regeneration, so you should focus on them one at a time. They can also boost their own attack and the attack of their allies, so you should take care of them first.
Wilex Text: I better get rid of them first, since they'll keep boosting all our enemies attacks. They also have regeneration, so I should focus on them first.
Luna Text: It's pretty shiny but also pretty deadly. They make our enemies stronger, so we should get rid of it first.

Name: Miracle Bloom
Bio Text: The strongest and rarest variation of Honeybuds. They have extremely powerful healing and powerful attacks.<line><line>Like Sunnybuds, Miracle Blooms can heal their allies and still stay in the air, allowing them to heal their allies for multiple turns in a row. They can also get off the ground and heal on the same turn.<line><line>Miracle Blooms are the only source of the rare Miracle Syrup.
Keru Text: Miracle Blooms are the strongest form of Honeybuds. Their attacks are very strong, and they can heal their allies for a lot of HP.
Wilex Text: Apparently their honey is really good at healing. Maybe I should take some for myself if I can. I should get rid of them first so they can't use it all up on their allies.
Luna Text: I bet their honey tastes really great. We'll have to focus on them first to get some though.

Name: Sun Sapling
Bio Text: The older form of the Rootling. At this stage of its life, the Sun Sapling rarely leaves the hole it buried itself in, although it can still leave it in emergencies.<line><line>The Sun Sapling gets most of its energy through absorbing sunlight through its leaves. This energy allows them to regenerate rapidly, and it can also share its energy with others to boost their power.<line><line>The Sun Sapling will also call forth other sun powered creatures to protect itself as well.
Keru Text: This is what the Rootling will grow up to be. Its leaves let it regenerate quickly and allows it to boost itself and its allies. It will keep calling allies as long as it's still alive.<next>If you're having trouble keeping up with doing more damage than it regenerates, then you chould try charging up to do all the damage you need to do as fast as possible.
Wilex Text: It regenerates pretty fast and it keeps calling allies for help...Oh great. I should focus on doing damage faster than it can regenerate, or else we won't be getting anywhere.<next>One of the things it summons can heal it though, so I should get rid of them too.
Luna Text: Wow, it's so big! It looks like it can regenerate pretty fast and summon some friends every so often. Everything it summons is flying, so Wilex should handle them.<next>Then I should focus on making sure we do damage faster than it can heal itself, but I might need Wilex's help for that too.

Name: Rockling
Bio Text: This is a rocky variant of the Leafling. Instead of being covered in leaves, this variant is covered with a rocky shell that gives them higher defense yet lower health. Outside of that, they are quite similar to regular Leaflings, as they still tend to bite anything that comes near them.
Keru Text: Rocklings are a version of Leaflings with a rocky shell instead of leaves covering them. The rock armor gives them some defense, but other than that they are the same as Leaflings.
Wilex Text: Stomping won't do much against that rocky shell of theirs. I think slashing will still work though. Maybe I can try Focusing if that still isn't enough.
Luna Text: It's covered in rocks, so stomping on it won't work. This looks like a job for my Hammer. Maybe I'll have to Power Smash if my hammer isn't doing enough.

Name: Honeybud
Bio Text: A variation of Flowerlings native to the Verdant Forest. The flower on its head produces honey, which it can use to heal its allies.<line><line>Healing allies is a strenuous process, which renders them grounded for a short time. They are also incapable of healing from the ground.<line><line>Unlike Flowerings, they can quickly get up off the ground on their turn. The honey can also be extracted to use as a food source.
Keru Text: Honeybuds can fly and heal their allies using the flower on their head. Like with Flowerlings, you can hit them to make them fall down, but they can fly back up on their turn.<next>When they're in the air, they can heal their allies with honey, but they fall down after healing.
Wilex Text: It's a flying healer, so I better focus on it first. They can't heal from the ground, so I should keep them down.<next>Sharing their honey will make them fall down, but they can get back up again pretty quickly.
Luna Text: The honey they make seems tasty, but they only share it with their own allies, so I should probably stop that.<next>There's not a lot I can do while they're flying, but they fall down every time they heal. Then it's my time to strike!

Name: Burrow Trap
Bio Text: Burrow Traps are carnivorous plants that can burrow down and come up in different places. They often try to take their prey by surprise, by emerging right next to them. Pollen from their bites makes their prey dizzy, making it harder for them to escape or fight back.<line><line>If they are attacked, they will retaliate with an attack stronger and faster than normal. Killing them won't stop them from countering, as they will get one last hit before dying.
Keru Text: Burrow Traps attack by biting you and covering you in pollen. The pollen makes you Dizzy for a short time, so you probably want to take care of them first if you aren't good at blocking.<next>However, they will retaliate whenever you hit them, so you should try to use your strongest attacks on them to get rid of them more quickly. They will always be able to make at least one counter attack though, no matter how hard you hit them.
Wilex Text: They really want to get their pollen in our eyes, and they also counter when they get hit, so I should hit them as hard as I can. But even if I do that, they'll still get one more counter in before they die.
Luna Text: Yuck! They really like getting their pollen everywhere! That pollen makes it hard for us to see, and they will also fight back when we hit them. Let's give them everything we got!

Name: Sundew
Bio Text: Sundews are strange plants that produce sticky poison droplets on the ends of their tentacles. They will lob these droplets at anyone who gets near them.<line><line>Attacking them will also cause them to retaliate, so care must be taken when trying to remove them. Killing them won't stop them from fighting back, as they will get one last attack in.
Keru Text: Sundews attack by fling sticky droplets towards you. Those droplets inflict Poison, so you should try your best to avoid them.<next>Attacking them will make them retaliate, so you should try to use your strongest attacks on them to get rid of them more quickly. They will always be able to make at least one counter attack though, no matter how hard you hit them.
Wilex Text: I better avoid those poison droplets they keep throwing around. They strike back when they get hurt, so I should hit them as hard as I can. But even if I kill them in one hit, they still get one last counter attack.
Luna Text: I really don't want that poison in my fur, so I should try avoiding their attacks. They fight back when they get hit though, so I should hit them as hard as possible.

Name: Leafswimmer
Bio Text: Leafswimmers attack with Light attacks and they can use Astral Wall on themselves.
Keru Text: Leafswimmers attack with Light attacks and they can use Astral Wall on themselves. It may be better to leave them for last as it can be difficult to get through it.
Wilex Text: It can shield itself, so I should get rid of them before they can do that. Dark attacks are stronger against them, so those are my best plan.
Luna Text: I can't use Earth or Light damage on them, but Dark damage is their weakness so I should use that.

Name: Brambleling
Bio Text: Bulky, healthy versions of normal Leaflings. They can soften their leaves to slow down damage dealt to them. They can also roar to boost the defense of all their allies.
Keru Text: Bramblelings are bulky versions of Leaflings. They can soften their leafy shell while boosting the defense of everyone.
Wilex Text: They can boost our allies defense, so we should get rid of them first. They can soften their leaves to make that annoying though.
Luna Text: It's covered in fluffy leaves, and they can soften themselves while making all their friends more defensive.

Name: Giant Vine
Bio Text: A massive vine summoned by the Master of Autumn. The powerful earth magic coursing through it gives it massive strength, allowing it to pick up and restrain those that would harm the Master. However, it always takes some preparation for it to grab someone, meaning that there is always an opportunity to prevent someone from being grabbed. If someone is grabbed by the vine, they will be restrained until the vine is destroyed or the person dies.
Keru Text: This large vine can slam into you but it can also grab you after a short time. The vine seems to have a short delay before trying to grab someone, so that's when you should really focus your attention on them.
Wilex Text: It's definitely looking at me funny, even though it doesn't even have eyes. I better cut it down before it tries anything. Luna better get me out if I get grabbed by this thing...
Luna Text: That's one big vine! It looks like it's strong enough to pick us up, so we should get rid of it before it can do that. Hopefully Wilex will save me if I get grabbed.

Name: Solardew
Bio Text: Solardews are stronger forms of Sundews. They can heal their allies and Illuminate them. Their counter attack hits twice with Light and Earth element.
Keru Text: Solardews can toss Light balls and counter with a 2 hit attack. They can also heal and Illuminate their allies.
Wilex Text: They toss Light balls at us and counter with a 2 hit attack. They can also heal and Illuminate their allies.
Luna Text: They toss Light balls at us and counter with a 2 hit attack. They can also heal and Illuminate their allies.

Name: Vine Platform
Bio Text: A stiff bundle of vines sturdy enough to stand on, an example of Sycamore's plant manipulation powers. While the vines can't attack on their own, they help Sycamore use stronger abilities than he would have on the ground.
Keru Text: It's a platform made from magical vines. It can't do much of anything on its own, but you should still bring it down since Sycamore is stronger while standing on it.
Wilex Text: It's just a platform, so it can't really do much. Sycamore is stronger on top of it, so I better cut it down soon.
Luna Text: The platform can't do much on its own, but breaking it will make Sycamore fall down. I can't reach him when he's high up so I'll have to break the platform.

Name: Sycamore
Bio Text: Sycamore is a man of principle, with deep reverence for the messages the forest sends him. If the forest tells him to tear down a settlement, he will do that without hesitation.<line><line>His family naturally has plant related magic, and so they naturally have leadership over those aligned with the Stonewood Temple.
Keru Text: This is Sycamore, one of the leaders of Stonewood Temple. He has the power to manipulate plants to attack. Once he is hurt enough, he will summon some plant allies to help him and he will stand on a raised vine platform.<next>You should try to get him down if you can, since he has stronger attacks while on that platform.
Wilex Text: He must've gone crazy, thinking the plants are talking to him. Either that, or he's just making that up for an excuse to do whatever he wants. Anyway, he has plant magic which lets him attack us with plants or summon plants to fight for him.<next>When he gets hurt enough, he'll get up onto a vine platform that we'll need to cut down.
Luna Text: LunaDefault_Sycamore

Name: Vine Throne
Bio Text: A massive vine throne summoned by the Master of Autumn. The vines on top form a protective shell around the one on the throne, making it impossible to target the one inside without destroying the throne first.
Keru Text: The Vine Throne protects the Master of Autumn from all attacks. You will need to destroy it to get to him. However, you shouldn't ignore the Giant Vines since they can grab you and take you out of the fight.
Wilex Text: Nothing can get to the Master of Autumn while this Throne is around. I'll have to cut it down fast. But I should make sure the Giant Vines don't grab me before I can destroy it...
Luna Text: The Throne keeps the Master of Autumn safe from all attacks, so we need to get rid of it to get to him. But those Giant Vines are also pretty dangerous, so I'll have to get rid of them too.

Name: Master of Autumn
Bio Text: Where spring is seen as a season of growth and beginnings, autumn is seen as a season of death and endings. Sycamore's responsibilities are a reflection of that, as he is the one who ensures that the plants and animals of the forest do not die unnecessarily, being the one who fights those who would defile the forest.<line><line> His plant manipulation power has become much stronger, allowing him to summon massive vines in order to attack and trap anyone who would attack him. The throne he summons will fully protect him from any harm, and also give him access to stronger attacks.
Keru Text: This is a form of Sycamore empowered by the magic of the seasons. It looks like he can summon much stronger vines to defend himself, being able to summon Giant Vines and a Vine Throne.<next>Like his original form, he is much stronger while on the Vine Throne, so make sure you destroy the throne as fast as you can.<next>However, the Giant Vines can grab you and take you out of the fight, so you will need to destroy them quickly as well.
Wilex Text: This guy can summon vines like last time, but they're a lot bigger now. The platform he makes will make him impossible to attack, so I better cut that down when he summons it. But I should also pay attention to the giant vines he summons too, since those can pick us up.
Luna Text: LunaDefault_Harvestborn

Name: Bandit
Bio Text: These frogs have large ears, allowing them to notice potential targets from further away. Regular bandits like these use short swords as their signature weapon, and they often try to catch their targets off guard with a feint before they strike. Bandits have a strong sense of comradery, always looking out for each other, making sure their spoils are divided fairly.
Keru Text: I've had a few too many encounters with these bandits. They roam the desert preying upon anyone who isn't one of them. Make sure you pay attention to their attacks, since they may try to fake you out.
Wilex Text: They picked the wrong guy to mess with. They can do a fake out with their swords, so I should watch out for that.
Luna Text: We're not gonna let them get a hand on our stuff! Their swords are pretty hard to keep track of, so I gotta pay close attention to them.

Name: Renegade
Bio Text: Spiky frogs usually become outcasts due to their threatening appearance. Pointy spines all over their back and head make it dangerous to get too close to them, while also giving them some defense. They also have sharp claws for attacking, and they can sometimes use a two hit attack.<line><line>Most spiky frogs tend not to wear much clothing, since most clothing would be torn up by the spines on their back.
Keru Text: Renegades have higher health and defense than normal frogs thanks to their spiky backs. Those spikes make them dangerous to stomp on, so you should hit them from a distance.<next>They can attack by slashing with their claws, sometimes hitting twice instead of once.
Wilex Text: All those spikes give them some defense, so I might need to Focus to get through that. They can do a double slash with their claws, so I should block that if I can.
Luna Text: Those spikes are pretty menacing, so I should use my hammer on them. I might need to do some Power Smashes since their defense is pretty high.

Name: Sentry
Bio Text: Sentries are frogs with the ability to inflate themselves and fly. They become electrified while airborne, so it is a good idea to attack them from a distance.<line><line>They attack by slinging rocks from above. Attacking them will provoke a paralyzing counter attack. Sentries usually focus their attention on the most vulnerable targets.
Keru Text: These frogs can blow themselves up like balloons to fly in the air, and they become electrified while airborne. They attack by tossing rocks at you with slings, but they will try to aim at whoever has the lowest health.<next>They can also counter attacks made against them with a paralyzing rock, so you should hit them with strong attacks to defeat them quickly.
Wilex Text: They always try to hit whoever's weakest, unless they're doing a counter attack. Taking them down is pretty hard since they're electrified when they're blown up, and electric attacks don't even work on them.<next>I'll also have to deal with their paralyzing counter attack if I get them down.
Luna Text: They look so funny when they're all blown up, but they get electrified when they do that. Maybe there's a way I can hit them without getting hurt myself?<next>Hitting them will make them hit back with a paralyzing rock, so I better be careful of that.

Name: Cactupole
Bio Text: These strange creatures inflate themselves in order to disguise themselves as floating cacti. Cactupoles have electrified skin when they fly, making them dangerous to come into contact with.<line><line>They have a lot of difficulty moving while inflated, so they have to deflate themselves to attack.<line><line>Their main predators are Sandswimmers, who can sense the electric fields they give off.
Keru Text: These tadpoles have hard skin and thorns that give them high defense and makes them look like cacti. They can inflate themselves to fly, and their attacks are more dangerous when they're in the air, since they can paralyze you.<next>However, they have to come down to attack you, so you can try to wait for that time to strike. Their thorns make them dangerous to jump on, so be careful when dealing with them.
Wilex Text: A flying cactus... Seems annoying to deal with. At least they'll fall down to the ground when they attack, so I should wait for that to happen.
Luna Text: I thought it was a normal cactus for a moment... Getting hit by their thorns will paralyze us, so we should try to avoid that. When they're flying I can't do too much to them, but they'll come down on their own, so I should wait for that.

Name: Sandswimmer
Bio Text: Sandswimmers are strange mammals that can swim through the sand like water. Their large bills allow them to sense electrical fields, which helps lead them towards potential food sources.<line><line>Their electrified skin makes them shocking to the touch, and also makes them immune to electrical attacks. The bandits in the desert occasionally use tamed Sandswimmers to help chase down their targets.
Keru Text: Sandswimmers are bulky beasts with high health but low attack. Try not to get bitten by them, since their bites can paralyze you. Their electrified skin gives them some defense and makes them immune to electrical attacks themselves.<next>You shouldn't stomp on them, since you'll get shocked on contact.
Wilex Text: These big beasts have pretty weak attacks, but they can paralyze us with their bites. They have shocking skin, which gives them a little bit of defense and makes them immune to electricity. Looks like I should use my sword for this one.
Luna Text: They move so fast... I wonder what it's like to ride one? That's probably a bad idea though, since their skin is shocking. They can also paralyze us with their bites, so we should be careful of that.

Name: Spire Guard
Bio Text: Spire guards protect the city of Windspire from the bandits using their rapiers, and they serve under Mayor Halberd. They are strong in groups as they can rally each other to make each other stronger.
Keru Text: Spire guards are usually found around Windspire. They fight with rapiers and they can rally each other to boost their attack, so picking them off one at a time can make them weaker.
Wilex Text: They can boost each other, so picking them off one at a time is a good idea.
Luna Text: They can boost each other, so we should take care of them one at a time.

Name: Elite Guard
Bio Text: Elite guards undergo difficult training that makes them very formidible spear fighters. Relatively few master their techniques so they are usually only seen guarding the most important areas of Windspire, including parts of Halberd's mansion. Elite guards can send waves of water at their opponents and protect them.
Keru Text: The elite guards of Windspire use different kinds of spear moves to fight. They can stab you twice, send water waves at you or protect themselves and others.
Wilex Text: They keep waving their spears around at us to fight. If I get rid of them first they can't keep their allies defense up.
Luna Text: They're twirling around their spear like it's nothing! Maybe I should switch to using one? They can boost their allies defense with it so I should take care of them first.

Name: Desert Bloom
Bio Text: Desert Blooms are the rarest form of Honeybuds, even rarer than the elusive Miracle Blooms. Unfortunately for those seeking rare honey from them, their flower only produces ordinary Flower Syrup. Their hustling abilities seem to be come from magic they have. Desert Blooms can shift their position to hide behind enemies with more health, or hide low health enemies behind themselves.
Keru Text: This is a Desert Bloom, the rarest form of the Honeybud. Their attacks are very strong, and they can heal their allies for a lot of HP and Hustle them.<next>They can also switch places with other enemies to hide behind ones with more health, or to go in front of ones with less.
Wilex Text: Apparently their honey is really good at healing and it makes their allies faster. But it looks like Flower Syrup, so I don't know how that works.<next>They can also switch places with other enemies to hide behind ones with more health, or to go in front of ones with less.
Luna Text: I bet their honey tastes really great. Their honey makes their allies move faster though, so taking care of them first is a good idea.<next>They can also switch places with other enemies to hide behind ones with more health, or to go in front of ones with less.

Name: Goldpole
Bio Text: A golden version of Brightpoles. Goldpoles are more aggressive but have lower defense and health than Brightpoles. Goldpoles can quickly zap enemies, so fighting them is often a race against the clock. They can Supercharge and Focus themselves on their actual turns.
Keru Text: Goldpoles are faster versions of Brightpoles. They can act after each of your actions. During their real turn, they will Focus and Supercharge themselves.
Wilex Text: They get a turn every time we move, so I better get rid of them first. They also charge themselves on their normal turn too so I shouldn't waste any time in dealing with them.
Luna Text: They fly so high and move so fast? Wilex should deal with them, I'm not very good at dealing with flying things and they get a free turn whenever either of us move.

Name: Shockworm
Bio Text: Shockworm bites can arc between their enemies and they can also charge themselves or match the focus of others. They are weak to Fire damage.
Keru Text: They can bite you do deal Air/Electric damage. That attack will also arc between you, so pay attention to that. They can also charge themselves to give themselves Supercharge and they can also copy the Focus of the other enemies.<next>They are weak to Fire damage.
Wilex Text: They're weak to Fire damage, so a Flame Stomp is good for getting rid of them. They can give themselves Focus or copy the Focus of the others so I should get rid of them before they can do that.
Luna Text: Fire damage is their weakness, so I can try a Flame Smash when they're down. They can give themselves Focus or copy the Focus of the others so I should get rid of them before they can do that.

Name: Brightpole
Bio Text: Brightpoles are larger and brighter versions of Cactupoles. They have an attack that blasts targets with light then one with darkness. Brightpoles can also blast their enemies with electricity.
Keru Text: These large, thorny tadpoles are larger forms of Cactupoles. They can attack with a large Light flash that hits both of you that is followed by a Dark attack that gives themselves Quantum Shield.<next>They can also blast you both with electricity to deal Air/Electric damage.
Wilex Text: A big flying cactus... Seems annoying to deal with. They can blast us with light and darkness or they can blast us with electricity.
Luna Text: It's a big bright thornball, I'll have to throw something at them to get them down. They can blast us with electricity but they can also do Light and Dark attacks.

Name: Stormswimmer
Bio Text: These relatives of Sandswimmers can actually fly in the storms of the Hidden Oasis. They can protect themselves with Mist Wall. Stormswimmers can shift their position to hide behind enemies with more health, or hide low health enemies behind themselves.
Keru Text: Stormswimmers attack with Electric attacks and they can blow water do deal Water damage and cast Mist Wall on themselves.<next>They can also switch places with other enemies to hide behind ones with more health, or to go in front of ones with less.
Wilex Text: It can blow water at us to give themselves Mist Wall, so I should get them before they can do that.<next>They can also switch places with other enemies to hide behind ones with more health, or to go in front of ones with less.
Luna Text: They're weak to Light damage, but I'll have to get them down first to get a good hit on them.<next>They can also switch places with other enemies to hide behind ones with more health, or to go in front of ones with less.

Name: Curl
Bio Text: Small guy (stompy guy?) (fought along Sentries)
Keru Text: KeruDefault_DesertMinibossA
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_DesertMinibossA
Luna Text: LunaDefault_DesertMinibossA

Name: Dart
Bio Text: Bigger guy (uses ranged multihits on different targets?) (fought along with Renegades)
Keru Text: KeruDefault_DesertMinibossB
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_DesertMinibossB
Luna Text: LunaDefault_DesertMinibossB

Name: Excision
Bio Text: Sword girl (fought along with bandits)
Keru Text: KeruDefault_DesertMinibossC
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_DesertMinibossC
Luna Text: LunaDefault_DesertMinibossC

Name: Flight
Bio Text: The leader of the desert bandits. His family once all lived in Windspire, but now his family is split, with half of them following Flight in becoming a part of the bandits.<line><line>Flight plans on using the Storm Cannon to take control of Windspire.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_DesertBossGuy
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_DesertBossGuy
Luna Text: LunaDefault_DesertBossGuy

Name: Storm Cannon
Bio Text: An ancient weapon used to bring the Air Dragon, Electrion out of the sky. It shoots out the electrical energy stored within to attack, and it can draw some energy from the environment.<line><line>However, the energy used to bring down Electrion came from the dragon himself, and so after his death there is now no way for the cannon to reach its maximum potential. Although, the power of the Air Core can still charge the cannon enough to be devastating.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_StormCannon
Wilex Text: It's a big hunk of metal that shoots lightning at us. We're probably better off focusing on taking down Flight, since this thing has a lot of defense and higher health than him.
Luna Text: LunaDefault_StormCannon

Name: Stormtamer
Bio Text: Stormhole began as a group of outcasts who were rejected and forced out of the cities in the desert. As they didn't have the favor of Electrion, most of them had to scavenge and steal supplies from traders in the desert in order to survive, giving rise to the Stormhole Bandits. The ultimate robbery of theirs would be to kill Electrion and take his power for themselves. The bandits built a cannon capable of using the great dragon's power against him, and struck him down with ease. Unfortunately, his death would render most of their settlement uninhabitable due to the energy he released, as well as the eternal storms that now perpetually surround Stormhole.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_Stormtamer
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_Stormtamer
Luna Text: LunaDefault_Stormtamer

Name: Stormkiller
Bio Text: The ancient cannon, now charged with an immense amount of energy. It takes some time to charge up, with the charging being interruptable. However, it can fortify itself, making it very difficult to prevent its ultimate attack from being used. The ultimate attack is unavoidable and impossible to survive, so interrupting its charge is crucial to defeating it.
Keru Text: Whatever you do, you must NOT let the cannon fire. Keep hitting it to reduce its level of charge. Its defense will increase every turn, so you need to defeat the cannon or the Stormtamer as fast as you can.
Wilex Text: There's a lot of energy in that thing. Getting hit by it will probably kill us, so I need to stop it from firing by hitting it hard. Electric attacks won't work since it will just absorb them.<next>Still, we're better off trying to take down the guy on top since the cannon has a lot more defense than him.<next>We need to be fast about this fight, since this thing will keep getting more defense every turn, so eventually we won't be able to stop it from firing anymore.
Luna Text: It's bright and sparking, but that's probably a bad thing. I don't think I want this thing to fire on us, so I think we should keep hitting it so it won't attack.

Name: Dummy
Bio Text: An ordinary training dummy. This dummy has been around from the very beginning of the Tournament , and yet it appears almost completely undamaged.
Keru Text: It's a normal training dummy. I don't think you need to worry about breaking it, since the other Tournament fighters probably used it before.
Wilex Text: Just a normal training dummy... It can survive anything we throw at it though. We don't need any training though, so we don't need this thing.
Luna Text: Did they have to give it a cute face like that? I feel kinda bad attacking it... Well it doesn't seem to mind, so I think it should be fine.

Name: Dummy?
Bio Text: It seems that the dummy was inhabited by a magical spirit deep within it. The immense power of the spirit kept the dummy from being damaged, but the spirit would lay dormant until someone peered deep inside the dummy to awaken it.<line><line>The existence of this spirit raises an important question: Are there others like it hiding elsewhere in the world?
Keru Text: What!? How did I not see this power before? Okay, it looks like whatever possessed the dummy can't move around, so if you run away, it can't stop you. You need to get out of there, I don't see any way you could win this.
Wilex Text: I knew there was something wrong with the face of this thing... It has more HP than anything else we've fought, so this is going to take a while. If we run away, it can't follow us, but I won't back down. We just have to fight like we've never fought before!
Luna Text: How strong is this guy? He has more HP than anyone else we've fought, so we'll have to fight harder than we've ever fought before! It can't catch us if we run away, but who knows what he could do if we left him alone?

Name: Boulder
Bio Text: Boulder has always lived in the shadow of his older siblings, and so he has always wanted to prove himself stronger than them by carving his own path. However, his time in the tournament has been a long string of losses with only a small handful of victories, keeping him at the bottom of the rankings. His determination hasn't been shaken by this however, and so he is willing to give it his all to finally rise above the bottom and defeat someone.
Keru Text: Boulder's losing streak is impressive, as much as it is sad. You would think that a losing streak like that would humble him, but he is very stubborn and arrogant, unwilling to change his fighting style or improve.
Wilex Text: He keeps using the same stomping attack over and over. No wonder he's losing every time. But I guess he has some pretty strong dedication, I probably would have dropped out of the tournament if I lost as much as he has.
Luna Text: Poor guy... Maybe we should let him win this one. No? Well, it doesn't look like he'll do anything other than stomp us, so this should be a simple fight.

Name: Lance
Bio Text: Lance is an eccentric fighter who relies a lot on his agility, being able to dodge a lot of his opponent's attacks, and also being able to attack very suddenly. While he may not be able to survive many hits against himself, a fluke upset against some of the higher ranking fighters has shown that his style isn't something that can be taken lightly.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentKnight
Wilex Text: It's hard to land a hit on him, so I'll have to pay attention to his stance. He gets a turn every time we move, so we should just keep trying to hit him as hard as we can.
Luna Text: So fast... He keeps zipping around to dodge my attacks. Maybe I can try to catch him off guard by attacking a certain way? He gets to attack every time we move, so we should just try to keep attacking him every turn.

Name: Ruby
Bio Text: Ruby and Aqua are two of the more recently joined fighters in the tournament, deciding to join to follow in their big sister's footsteps. Ruby is focused on copying her older sister's fighting style by being very aggressive with her attacks.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentBishopA
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_TournamentBishopA
Luna Text: LunaDefault_TournamentBishopA

Name: Aqua
Bio Text: Ruby and Aqua are two of the more recently joined fighters in the tournament, deciding to join to follow in their big sister's footsteps. Aqua is more reserved than her sisters, and she has a more defensive fighting style as well.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentBishopB
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_TournamentBishopB
Luna Text: LunaDefault_TournamentBishopB

Name: Stronghold
Bio Text: Formerly one of Halberd's guards, Stronghold has decided to join the tournament for a change of pace.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentRook
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_TournamentRook
Luna Text: LunaDefault_TournamentRook

Name: Amethyst
Bio Text: Amethyst was a member of the first 2 person team allowed to compete in the Windspire Tournament. Her aggressive approach complimented her partner's more defensive approach, allowing the two of them to become champions for a short time.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentQueenA
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_TournamentQueenA
Luna Text: LunaDefault_TournamentQueenA

Name: Glaive
Bio Text: Glaive was a member of the first 2 person team allowed to compete in the Windspire Tournament. Some thought that this was due to corruption, as her brother is the mayor of Windspire. Yet this is likely not the case, as Halberd appears to have little to no interest in the tournament. She and her partner managed to rise all the way to the top, becoming champions for a short time, although they would lose their title shortly after gaining it.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentQueenB
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_TournamentQueenB
Luna Text: LunaDefault_TournamentQueenB

Name: Crest
Bio Text: The brother of the first champion, Crest has a fast and versatile attacking style that has led him to victory countless times, even against teams of fighters.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_TournamentKing
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_TournamentKing
Luna Text: LunaDefault_TournamentKing

Name: Summit
Bio Text: The original champion of the Windspire Tournament. He left the tournament soon after the very first two person team entered the tournament.  From his perspective, allowing teams to compete would let weaklings take the title of Champion. His anger at this change reached its height when he was defeated by a team and lost his title for the first time after he got it. After winning his title back, he would disappear, taking the Champion Ribbon with him.
Keru Text: He's the original champion of the tournament. Even after all this time in hiding, he still hits extremely hard. You will need to watch his attacks closely, as they will do a lot more damage if you fail to block them.<next>He also has the ability to block your attacks if you don't do them correctly.<next>His fighting style is one where he often does massive attacks that make him need to recover after doing them, so you should use that downtime to prepare yourself for his next moves.
Wilex Text: "Real champion"? Yeah, right. Like you're anything but a coward for hiding up here. He hits hard, but blocking works better than normal against his attacks. If I mess up my attacks, he'll block them completely too.<next>After his bigger moves he'll take some time to recover, so I should watch out for those.
Luna Text: He looks a lot bigger than his brother, but he's been staying up here alone for a long time. I'll need to stay focused, since all his attacks will hurt a lot more if I don't block.<next>He'll even block my attacks if I mess them up too. His bigger attacks make him tired when he does them, so maybe that's a good time to heal myself.

Name: Slime
Bio Text: A very common creature in the Gemstone Islands. They are naturally curious, so they will usually approach anyone who comes near them. Anything they're curious about ends up being covered in slime, since they often jump into things to get a better look at them. Attacking them splits off a smaller version of themselves.
Keru Text: Slimes are pretty weak, but they have two different ways of stomping. Their higher stomp will deal Water damage while their lower stomp does normal damage. They are somewhat weak to electrical attacks.<next>Attacking them will split off a smaller version of themselves with less health, so using strong attacks on them can avoid that.
Wilex Text: These little guys don't look very strong, but they can still stomp us pretty hard. Electricity is their weakness, so it's a good time for an Electro Stomp.<next>I should try to beat them in one hit, or else they will split off a smaller slime with less health.
Luna Text: Slimes like jumping around. Sometimes they jump low, but sometimes they can jump really high to hit us harder. Maybe I can learn something from them about jumping?<next>Hitting them splits off a cute mini slime, so I should try to beat them in one hit.

Name: Slimewalker
Bio Text: A Slime that has taken a form similar to the jellyfish in the Gemstone Islands. They can launch slime balls at their enemies, which will hit the one who will take more damage from it.
Keru Text: These slimes look like the jellyfish in the Gemstone Islands, and they sometimes try to mimic them. They can attack by slashing with a sharp tentacle or by shooting a slime ball.<next>Their slime ball attack will target the one that will take the most damage from it, so defensive boosts may not be helpful here.
Wilex Text: It looks like a jellyfish, but it's actually just another slime. They can slash us or shoot slime balls at us. They must be pretty smart, since they will shoot their slime at whichever of us will take the most damage.<next>Electric attacks are their weakness, so I should try using those against them.
Luna Text: It looks like a slimy jellyfish. They can slash at us or shoot water balls.

Name: Slimeworm
Bio Text: A strange creature that anchors itself in place to draw nutrients from the ground. They are almost never seen outside of their anchored state. They launch water bombs out of their tail in order to defend themselves. Their attacks are quite slow, requiring a full turn to prepare themselves to fire.
Keru Text: Slimeworms are large creatures that draw nutrients from the ground to empower themselves. They can charge to give themselves Focus and Absorb, and they will shoot large slime balls after charging.<next>They also have thick skin that gives them high defense. However, they are weak to Earth damage.
Wilex Text: These worms have high defense, so I probably need to Focus to be able to hit them hard enough. It looks like these guys have the same idea, since they keep doing charge attacks.
Luna Text: They're too tall for me to stomp on, so I'll have to use my hammer on them. I might have to Power Smash them since their defense is pretty high. They seem weak to Earth damage though, so maybe that's another way to beat them.

Name: Slimebloom
Bio Text: A strange flower-like creature made of slime. Similar to Slimeworms, they anchor themselves in place to draw nutrients from the ground. However, they have weaker attacks since they are much smaller. They will attack by throwing balls of water at their target or by firing a lightning bolt at them. Their tentacles are electrified, making direct contact with them dangerous. However, they are weak to Paralyze despite being covered in electricity.
Keru Text: They are not actually flowers, but they still draw energy from the ground. You should be careful to block their attacks, since they can paralyze you or put you to sleep.<next>Their tentacles are also electrified, so you shouldn't stomp on them. Strangely, they are weak to being paralyzed despite being immune to electricity.
Wilex Text: Weird looking flowers... Those tentacles are electrified so electrical attacks won't work on them. They can paralyze us if we're not careful, and they can also lob sleepy slime at us.<next>We better get rid of them fast so they can't paralyze us or put us to sleep. They're weak to being paralyzed, so maybe we should give them a taste of their own medicine.
Luna Text: I can't tell if these are flowers or not... Getting a closer look is probably a bad idea since I'll get shocked by their tentacles. They can zap and paralyze us, and they can also lob slime balls at us to put us to sleep.<next>We should get rid of them so they can't do that.

Name: Siren Fish
Bio Text: These strange fish are always covered in slime, which often forms into bubbles that they use to fly and attack. This is an adaptation to avoid predators, since there aren't any flying predators within the Gemstone Islands or the oceans they usually inhabit. They often sing songs, which can put their enemies to sleep or make their allies stronger.
Keru Text: These fish can fly using bubbles created from the slime on their skin. Their main attack is blowing sedative bubbles at you. They can also empower all their allies, so you should take care of them quickly.<next>However, they can't boost their allies if they're grounded, so that is another way to stop them from boosting everyone.
Wilex Text: They're covered in slime... Shouldn't they be called "Slimefish"? The bubbles they blow can put us to sleep, and they can also sing a song that boosts all their allies. They can't sing while on the ground so I better get them down when I can.
Luna Text: It looks like a flying worm, but apparently it's a fish of some kind. They can put us to sleep with their bubbles, or sing songs that can make their allies stronger. Looks like Wilex will have to get them down, since I have a hard time hitting flying things.

Name: Urchiling
Bio Text: Urchilings are very slow attackers, but their charge can also give themselves Astral Wall which makes it harder to prevent them from getting their charge attack done.
Keru Text: Urchilings charge up water attacks on both of you. They give themselves Astral Wall when they charge up, which makes it harder to stop their charge atatacks.
Wilex Text: They charge up big water attacks but give themselves Astral Wall when they charge up so it's hard to stop them.
Luna Text: They're covered in spikes but they don't attack very fast. Hurting them might be hard since they give themselves Astral Wall when they charge up.

Name: Golden Slime
Bio Text: The rarest and the strongest of the slime types, Golden slimes are capable of mimicing others abilities or copying the forms of others. Golden Slimes can also invert enemy effects or extend their allies effects and heal them.
Keru Text: Golden slimes can copy moves from their allies or even turn into them. They can also splash you with Air/Electric damage and invert your effects or give their allies regeneration and extend their effects.
Wilex Text: Golden slimes can turn into other enemies or copy their moves. They can also invert our effects or give their allies regeneration.
Luna Text: They're shiny but they can copy our other enemies moves or even turn into them. They can also invert our effects or give each other regeneration.

Name: Elemental Slime
Bio Text: Elemental slimes are immune to normal damage but weak to all elements and ailments. They apply buffs to others and can give allies Focus, Astral Wall or healing. They attack in a splash attack then single attack pattern for their elemental moves.
Keru Text: Elemental slimes are immune to normal damage, but weak to any other element. They can hit you with spread and stomp elemental attacks of any element, and their moves can also heal their allies or apply Focus or Astral Wall.
Wilex Text: Elemental slimes have a lot of different elemental attacks. They can also heal or buff their allies so we shouldn't ignore them.
Luna Text: They splash us with elemental damage, but they can get hurt by elemental stuff too.

Name: Normal Slime
Bio Text: Normal slimes can resist all negative effects and elemental damage. Both of their attacks will cleanse positive effects from you, but their spread attack also inflicts Exhaust.
Keru Text: Normal slimes are immune to everything but normal damage, and they can also erase your buffs when they hit you.
Wilex Text: They get rid of our buffs, and they can exhaust us. Nothing but normal damage can hurt them also.
Luna Text: You can't hurt them with anything but normal damage, so I guess that's what we're gonna do. They can get rid of our buffs and Exhaust us too, so we shouldn't ignore them.

Name: Soft Slime
Bio Text: Soft slimes only take 1 damage from attacks but have relatively low health. They can heal their allies or give their allies Soften. Soft Slimes can only heal allies one at a time, so spread attacks are useful against them.
Keru Text: These fluffy slimes can only take 1 damage from your attacks, but you only need a few of them to defeat them. They can stomp on their allies to heal them or give them Soften.<next>Since they can only heal one at a time, spread attacks are good at dealing with them.
Wilex Text: The stuff they're made of makes it hard to cut through them, anything I do only does 1 damage at a time. They can jump on others to heal them, so spread attacks can stop that.
Luna Text: It's hard to get a good hit on them so they only take one damage at a time, but they don't hve much health anyway. They jump on their allies to heal them, so spread attacks can stop that.

Name: Rigid Slime
Bio Text: Rigid slimes can only take lehal damage. They use single target attacks or give themselves Quantum Shield. If left alone for too long, they can split into two with less health, which may be the only way to beat them if you don't have many high damage attacks.
Keru Text: Rigid slimes attack by jumping on you or by charging up for a bigger jump. Their stiff bodies will make them immune to any attack that doesn't kill them outright, but they can split themselves into two if they're left for too long.
Wilex Text: They jump on us normally or charge up big jumps. Weak hits do nothing against them, but one strong hit will break them completely. They'll split apart if left alone for too long, so if we can't beat them normally that is another way to deal with them.
Luna Text: They jump at us or charge up bigger jumps. If we leave them alone, they'll split into two so we can wait if we can't hurt them.<next>Hitting them won't do anything unless we hit them hard enough to beat them in one hit.

Name: Arm
Bio Text: The arm of the False Dragon. When it gets destroyed, it will reform while the False Dragon is underwater, so the arm will be back when the False Dragon resurfaces.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_FalseDragonArm
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_FalseDragonArm
Luna Text: LunaDefault_FalseDragonArm

Name: False Dragon
Bio Text: A massive, strange creature made from an amalgamation of many Slimes and Jellyfish in the Gemstone Islands. It loosely resembles the Water Dragon Aquaria. The power of the Water Core held the amalgam together, and so the removal of the Water Core led to the False Dragon's dissolution.<line><line>The False Dragon's main method of attack is diving underwater and then creating massive waves when it resurfaces.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_FalseDragon
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_FalseDragon
Luna Text: LunaDefault_FalseDragon

Name: Left Arm
Bio Text: Weak physical moves
Keru Text: KeruDefault_AmalgamLeftArm
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_AmalgamLeftArm
Luna Text: LunaDefault_AmalgamLeftArm

Name: Right Arm
Bio Text: The right arm of the Amalgam has many different elemental weaknesses, but it has stronger moves than the left arm. (stronger elemental stuff and buffs) (Morbid boost so that if you keep it alive too long it gets attack increase a lot)
Keru Text: KeruDefault_AmalgamRightArm
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_AmalgamRightArm
Luna Text: LunaDefault_AmalgamRightArm

Name: Discordant Amalgam
Bio Text: The noble goal of fostering cooperation between everyone on the Gemstone Islands was distorted into the creation of this amalgam. Its mind is filled with the contradicting thoughts and feelings of those it absorbed, with the only shared goal of growing the amalgam even further. The Amalgam's green coloration came from the combination of the blue of normal Slime and the yellow of Golden Slimes.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_AmalgamsWill
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_AmalgamsWill
Luna Text: LunaDefault_AmalgamsWill

Name: Blazecrest
Bio Text: Blazecrests are the strongest of the Flamecrests. They use their natural capabilities to fight enemies, seeing weapon users as weaklings who can't really fight. Their scales give them some defense, but they are weak to water attacks. The burning crests on their head and their burning clothing means that direct attacks will burn you. Blazecrests often see themselves as the ideal form of Flamecrests, since they are the strongest and have the strongest fire breath.<line><line>Their main attack is breathing a massive stream of fire to hit all their enemies at once. They can also roar at enemies to make them Berserk.
Keru Text: Blazecrests use their strong fire breath to hurt you, but they can also roar at you to make you Berserk.<next>They have higher health than other Flamecrests, but they have the same water weakness most other Blazecrests have, so water is the best way to beat them.
Wilex Text: Their heads are on fire, so obviously water attacks are the way to go here. I should beat them first because their fire breath is pretty strong, and their roar attack can make us Berserk.
Luna Text: These hotheads are always looking to pick a fight! A bit of water should help them cool off, so we should try using that kind of attack.

Name: Embercrest
Bio Text: Embercrests are not as strong as Blazecrests and have much weaker fire breath, only being able to produce smaller fireballs instead of a massive stream of flame. They have more defense than Blazecrests but they still have the same water weakness. Embercrests are the majority of the Flamecrest population, making up roughly 50% of them.<line><line>They tend to use a sword in addition to their fiery attacks to fight enemies. They usually slash twice with their sword attacks.
Keru Text: Embercrests have some defense and they use their swords to attack. They use a dual slash pattern to attack, but they can also shoot a fireball to hit someone with Fire damage.<next>Embercrests have the same water weakness most other Flamecrests have, so try using water on them if you can.
Wilex Text: Two swords... Don't they know one is enough? They can use both swords to attack or they can shoot fireballs at us. That armor they're wearing gives them some defense too. Water attacks are a good idea, but poison also works on them.
Luna Text: The armor they're wearing gives them some defense, but they're still weak to Water like almost everything else in the Caldera. They attack by slashing us or by shooting fireballs at us.

Name: Ashcrest
Bio Text: Ashcrests are the weakest of the Flamecrests. Unlike other Flamecrests, they are not weak to water, but they are slightly weak to fire attacks instead. Ashcrests are often looked down upon by other Flamecrests because they can't breathe fire at all, and often times their crests aren't even on fire.<line><line>They tend to rely on bomb attacks since they are quite weak physically.
Keru Text: Ashcrests have the lowest health and defense of Flamecrests, but they don't have the same water weakness of other Flamecrests. They are actually slightly weak to fire damage though.<next>They use shock bombs and water bombs to attack instead of attacking directly.
Wilex Text: Sneaky little guys... They can't breathe fire, but the bombs they throw are pretty annoying. Each bomb can only hit one of us, with one bomb being a water bomb and another bomb being a shock bomb.<next>They're not weak to water, but fire works fine against them.
Luna Text: They're pretty shy and scared, so they keep their distance to throw bombs at us. One of them is a water bomb and the other is a shock bomb. They're not weak to water, but they are weak to fire.

Name: Flametongue
Bio Text: Flametongues are an all female species of scaly mammals with very long tongues. Somehow, their tongues are longer than their bodies. They stick out their tongues to burn enemies from a distance.<line><line>Flametongues are found in small numbers all around the Infernal Caldera, but the largest group of them lives on Silver Island.
Keru Text: Flametongues are actually mammals, despite how they're covered in scales. They can burn both of you with their long tongues. Their thick scales give them a lot of defense and makes them almost immune to fire attacks.<next>Electric attacks are a good way of beating them.
Wilex Text: Their tongues are really long... How do they fit in their bodies? They attack by licking both of us at the same time to burn us. I'll need to use electrical attacks to get through their thick scales.<next>Paralyzing them also seems like a good idea too.
Luna Text: These girls are tough, even if they don't have as much health as everything else around here, and that's because of their big scales. They attack by licking us with their long burning tongues.<next>Wilex might have an easier time dealing with them since he has some Electric attacks he can use here.

Name: Heatwing
Bio Text: Heatwings are fiercely territorial, so they will attack anyone unfamiliar who intrudes on their territory. Their main attacks are swooping down on targets or flapping their wings to burn a large area with their burning wings. Like  many other fiery creatures, water attacks are especially effective against them.
Keru Text: Heatwings are flying reptiles with burning wings. Like many other burning creatures, they are weak to water damage, but you may need to bring them down to use water against them. They can flap their wings to spread fire to hit both of you.<next>Their other method of attack is to swoop down at a target twice.
Wilex Text: Another fiery enemy... Water attacks are a good idea, but I'll have to get them down to hit them with one. The fiery wind they can blow with their wings isn't that strong, but they can also swoop down to hit us twice.
Luna Text: They're flying up high, so it looks like Wilex will have to deal with them. He should hit them with a Water attack since they're weak to those. They can swoop down on us twice to attack, or use their wings to blow fire onto us.

Name: Lavaswimmer
Bio Text: These large reptiles have perpetually burning scales on their backs that make it dangerous to jump on them. Domesticated Lavaswimmers are often used as a source of leather, meat and eggs. However, wild Lavaswimmers often have stronger flames on their backs, which are better suited for making the infinitely burning leather that inhabitants of the Caldera wear.
Keru Text: Lavaswimmers are covered in burning scales that make it dangerous to come into contact with them. This is their main defense mechanism, as their attacks are somewhat weak. They can bite you and they can also shoot fireballs at you.<next>They aren't weak to water, but electric attacks are very effective against them, so that is a good way to beat them.
Wilex Text: They have pretty weak attacks, but they can shoot fireballs at us. They have burning skin, which gives them a little bit of defense and makes them immune to fire. They're weak to electricity and paralysis, so that might be a way to beat them faster.
Luna Text: Lavaswimmers are big, but they don't have as strong attacks as other stuff in the Caldera. They have a lot of health though

Name: Pyrenfish
Bio Text: Pyrenfish can attack by shooting the oil from their bodies or by using the oil for Fire attacks. They can also sing a song that gives themselves Counter Flare and their allies Focus.
Keru Text: These fish can fly using the oily bubbles on their backs. Their main attack is blowing oily bubbles to inflict Splotch, but they can also breathe fire. They can also empower all their allies and give themselves Counter Flare, so you should take care of them quickly.<next>However, they can't boost their allies if they're grounded, so that is another way to stop them from boosting everyone.
Wilex Text: It's a fiery Sirenfish, so that's why they're Pyrenfish. The bubbles they blow can Splotch us, they can also breathe fire on us, and they can also sing a song that boosts all their allies. They can't sing while on the ground so I better get them down when I can.
Luna Text: It looks like a flying worm, but apparently it's a fish of some kind. They can cover us in oil with their bubbles, breathe fire, or sing songs that can make their allies stronger. Looks like Wilex will have to get them down, since I have a hard time hitting flying things.

Name: Gold Screecher
Bio Text: Goldscreechers are stronger and faster versions of Heatwings. Each of their attacks hits many times.
Keru Text: Goldscreechers are flying reptiles with burning wings that are a stronger version of Heatwings. Like many other burning creatures, they are weak to water damage, but you may need to bring them down to use water against them. <next>They can swoop down to you five times or spread flame onto you three times.
Wilex Text: Another fiery enemy... Water attacks are a good idea, but I'll have to get them down to hit them with one. Their fiery wind hits us three times and they can swoop on us five times, so we shouldn't let them get too strong.
Luna Text: They're flying up high, so it looks like Wilex will have to deal with them. He should hit them with a Water attack since they're weak to those. They can swoop down on us five times to attack, or use their wings to blow fire three times onto us.

Name: Infernoling
Bio Text: Infernolings are covered in very hot burning spikes that make it dangerous to get close to them. They can roar to Illuminate themselves and reduce the defense of their enemies.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_DesertMinibossA
Wilex Text: They're too hot to get close to without hurting us
Luna Text: They're too hot to get close to without hurting us, so maybe we can attack from afar?

Name: Magmaswimmer
Bio Text: Magmaswimmers are slow and large versions of Lavaswimmers. They attack slowly, waiting to charge up a massive fireball.
Keru Text: Magmaswimmers are covered in burning scales that make it dangerous to come into contact with them. They can also hide themselves when they charge up.<next>They aren't weak to water, but electric attacks are very effective against them, so that is a good way to beat them.
Wilex Text: They attack pretty slowly, but they cn shoot big fireballs at us. They have burning skin, which gives them a little bit of defense and makes them immune to fire. They're weak to electricity and paralysis, so that might be a way to beat them faster.
Luna Text: Magmaswimmers are big, and they hide themselves when they charge up their big fireballs. I should hit them with Light when they do that.

Name: Wyverlet
Bio Text: Wyverlets are juvenile Lava Wyverns. They are very territorial, though they usually prefer to fight intruders to the Molten Pit. They can blow flame wind twice or screech to reduce the attack and defense of their enemies while giving themselves Counter Flare. They can also counterattack to give themselves an attack boost and Counter Flare as well.
Keru Text: Wyverlets are flying reptiles with burning wings. Like many other burning creatures, they are weak to water damage, but you may need to bring them down to use water against them. They can flap their wings to spread fire to hit both of you twice.<next>They can also screech to deal Dark damage and apply Attack Down and Defense Down. They can also counterattack you to give themselves Attack Up and Counter Flare.
Wilex Text: Another fiery enemy... Water attacks are a good idea, but I'll have to get them down to hit them with one. The fiery wind hits us twice, and they can screech to reduce our attack and defense. They can also counterattack too, so I should be careful of that.
Luna Text: They're flying up high, so it looks like Wilex will have to deal with them. He should hit them with a Water attack since they're weak to those. They can screech us as their attack and their counterattack, or use their wings to blow fire onto us twice.

Name: Lava Wyvern
Bio Text: A large beast that came from a deep part of the Infernal Caldera. The secrets to taming beasts like this were known only to the fallen House Roseeye.<line><line>Lepidol relies on this beast to fight for him. The bond between them appeared quite strong, until the beast left him behind after it was defeated.
Keru Text: KeruDefault_LavaWyvern
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_LavaWyvern
Luna Text: LunaDefault_LavaWyvern

Name: Metal Wyvern
Bio Text: The bright blue flame is created by burning metal compounds on its back
Keru Text: KeruDefault_MetalWyvern
Wilex Text: WilexDefault_MetalWyvern
Luna Text: LunaDefault_MetalWyvern

Name: Eye Spore
Bio Text: Eye Spores are small fungal spores that can move on their own that can only grow in the darkness of the Shrouded Valley. These spores can infect targets to turn them into spore zombies. However, the spore infection can only take hold if the target actually dies, so they will try their best to focus on vulnerable targets. The spores also cannot survive outside of the Shrouded Valley, so those only visiting the Valley for a short time are rarely infected by them.<line><line>Eye spores attack by shooting small spore balls at targets. They are weak to Fire and Earth damage.
Keru Text: If you're feeling like you're being watched down here, there's a good chance it's one of these creatures. They focus most of their attacks on the enemy with the lowest health, and their attacks get stronger when you have less health.<next>Make sure you keep your health as high as possible. Fire and Earth are their main weaknesses so you should use those damage types to beat them quickly.
Wilex Text: I don't like how they're looking at me... They will try to hit whoever has the lowest health, and their attacks are a lot stronger when we have less health. We should get rid of them before our hp gets too low.<next>Fire attacks are one of their weaknesses, so that's what I should do to beat them.
Luna Text: They're so creepy! The spore gunk they shoot will hurt a lot more when we have less health, so I should make sure to keep our health up. I can also use Earth damage to get rid of them fast.

Name: Spike Shroom
Bio Text: These mushrooms are balls of very sharp spikes, and their spikes can inflict poison on attackers. Their spikes are very stiff, giving them high defense. Spike Shrooms will try to poke creatures they sense in order to spread their spores. They are weak to Electric and Earth damage.
Keru Text: Spike Shrooms are covered in spikes, like what the name suggests. You should avoid being hit by their spikes, since all of them are filled with poison. Their spikes give them high defense, but Electric or Earth attacks will get rid of them quickly.
Wilex Text: All those spikes are make it hard to get a good hit on them, but electricity will still work pretty well. I won't get poked by the spikes if I Electro Stomp them, so that's probably the way to beat these things.
Luna Text: So sharp and pointy... I should get rid of them fast so I don't get poked. They look like they can poison us too. I feel like a Leafy Stomp will do a good job at that.

Name: Shrouder
Bio Text: A spore creature that has absorbed some of the illusory power of the Shrouded Valley. This allows them to hide their allies from attacks. These creatures are mostly hollow on the inside, making them buoyant enough to fly.<line><line>They attack by spreading large clouds of spores to weaken enemies. They can only shroud their allies while airborne, so grounding them is a good way to prevent that.
Keru Text: These are one of the more insidious creatures of the Shrouded Valley. Shrouders can hide their allies from your attacks, and they can blow clouds of spores that make it harder to use skills.<next>Make sure you remove them first or else you'll be fighting an uphill battle.
Wilex Text: Shrouders can hide our enemies from attacks and blow dark clouds that make it harder for us to move. I better get rid of it first so it won't slow us down.
Luna Text: It's flying up high and it can hide all our enemies from us. Wilex should take it out first so that won't happen.

Name: Hoarder Fly
Bio Text: These creatures can convert the dark energy of the Valley into healing light, but they hoard this energy instead of using it for the most part. Their bites actually heal their targets by a small amount, but their bites also inject strong venom as well.<line><line>Hoarder Flies are commonly hunted for food as they are one of the few non-fungal creatures in the Shrouded Valley.
Keru Text: Hoarder Flies have healing magic, but they almost never use it willingly. Their bites will heal you for a small amount, but their bites have some venom that will poison you. They can also swoop down on you multiple times to do damage normally.
Wilex Text: Apparently they have healing abilities, but they usually keep it all to themselves, which is pretty good for us. They will fight pretty viciously to defend themselves though.<next>Their bites heal us a tiny amount but also poisons us, and they can also swoop down on us multiple times. We should get rid of it first so it can't poison us.
Luna Text: They're one of the few light sources down in the Valley, but they're still pretty dangerous. Their bites heal us a little bit but give us strong Poison. They can also swoop down on us multiple times as their attack.

Name: Mosquito
Bio Text: Mosquitos distrust almost everyone they come across, due to their fear of the spore zombies in the Shrouded Valley. A spore infection causes the target to act slightly differently than they normally do, so mosquitos are hyper vigilant for small behavior changes in those they know. Outsiders can't become spore zombies, but Mosquitoes are still paranoid around them. Their weapons of choice are needles, which they use to weaken opponents. They can also drain health from opponents by biting them, and they usually target the one who looks healthiest.
Keru Text: Mosquitoes will try to bite you and suck your blood to heal themselves, but they also have a needle to defend themselves with. Their needle will Paralyze you as well as inflict Sunder which will lower your defense.<next>They tend to target whoever looks healthiest when they're looking for someone to bite. You should take care of them quickly, so they don't heal back the damage you do to them.
Wilex Text: Bloodsuckers... They drain our blood to heal themselves, and they try to bite whoever looks healthiest. They also have needles they can use to Paralyze us and lower our defense.<next>Luna doesn't do well around needles, so I should probably help her out with this one.
Luna Text: Why do they have to like needles so much? They can Paralyze and lower our defense with their needles, or suck our blood with their big needle mouth. Okay, I can do this, I just have to take care of them before they can heal themselves too much.

Name: Toxiwing
Bio Text: Toxiwings have toxic wings and attacks by draining health from enemies or by swooping down to deal Fire element and give themselves Counter Flare.
Keru Text: Toxiwings attack by draining health from you or by swooping down and burning you and giving Counter Flre to themselves. Their health drain attack targets the healthier of you two while the swoop attack targets the least healthy of you.
Wilex Text: They drain our blood to heal themselves, and they try to bite whoever looks healthiest. They can also swoop down on whoever is the least healthiest to do fire damage and give themselves Counter Flare.
Luna Text: They have needle beaks and can suck our blood through them. Yuck! They'll probably be after me more often since they like to hit whoever is healthiest. They can also swoop on us to do fire dmage and give themselves Counter Flare.

Name: Gold Fly
Bio Text: Gold flies don't have the same healing as Hoarder Flies, but they can strengthen themselves whenever their allies die. They can blow golden wind to deal Air/Electric damage, and they can bite to apply Sunder.
Keru Text: Gold flies don't have the same healing as Hoarder Flies, but they can strengthen themselves whenever their allies die. They can blow golden wind to deal Air/Electric damage, and they can bite to apply Sunder.
Wilex Text: They can blow electric wind at us or bite us to make us weaker.<next>They get stronger whenever any other enemy dies, so we should get rid of it first so it can't get any stronger.
Luna Text: They're really bright, but they're still pretty dangerous. Their bites give us Defocus and Sunder. They can also swoop down on us multiple times as their attack.<next>Whenever we get rid of other enemies, they get stronger, so we gotta get rid of it first!

Name: Maw Spore
Bio Text: Maw Spores can bite you to steal your positive effects, but they can also devour other enemies that have low health to strengthen themselves. They can also lick you to deal Water damage and steal your energy as well. Attacking them will provoke a counterattack, like with normal Eye Spores.
Keru Text: Maw Spores can bite you to steal your positive effects, but they can also devour other enemies that have low health to strengthen themselves. They can also lick you to deal Water damage and steal your energy as well.<next>Attacking them will provoke a counterattack, so be careful when fighting them.
Wilex Text: They can eat our buffs and eat their allies too to get stronger. Taking them out first will stop them from getting too strong. They can lick us to steal energy.
Luna Text: They can eat our buffs but they can also eat their own allies too. They can lick us to steal our energy too, so we better get rid of them first!

Name: Cave Spider
Bio Text: Cave Spiders are smaller versions of the Spore Spider. They can protect themselves or weave copies of other enemies. They can hang from their own silk to fly up.
Keru Text: Cave Spiders can hang from their own silk and they can also shield themselves or weave copies of other enemies.
Wilex Text: We've dealt with a bigger one before, this one is no problem. The cave spiders around here can shield themselves or make copies of other enemies, and they can also fly up by hanging from their silk.
Luna Text: Why does everything around here have to be so creepy? These spiders can shield themselves or weave up more friends for themselves.

Name: Obscurer
Bio Text: Obscurers are stronger versions of Shrouders. The main thing that makes Obscurers so dangerous is that nothing can hurt them as long as any of their allies has more health than them. However, Obscurers also have negative defense so they are easy to remove after their allies were weakened
Keru Text: The worst of the worst of the Shrouded Valley. Obscurers can hide their allies from your attacks but they can't be hit if any of their allies are healthier than them. They can also blow clouds of spores that make it harder to use skills and permanently boosts their attack.<next>Make sure you get through everything quickly so you can deal with them.
Wilex Text: Obscurers can hide our enemies from attacks and blow dark clouds that make it harder for us to move and boosts them permanently. We can't even hit them unless everything healthier than them is gone. We have to go fast so they can't get too strong.
Luna Text: It's flying up high and it can hide all our enemies from us. We can't touch it unless everything with more health is gone. Maybe that's what I cn doing?

Name: Spore Spider
